body:
[Some interesting machine learning things from kaggle competitions](http://www.kaggle.com)

1. ## [Rossmann store  sales  competition](http://alexandrudaia.github.io/RossmannStoreSales/)
    ### In progess

2. ## [Caterpillar tube pricing](http://alexandrudaia.github.io/Buldozere/)

3. ##[Tab food investment  competition](http://alexandrudaia.github.io/tfi-competition/)

4. ##[Kinetic energy correlation ](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Octav_Onicescu) in [R](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/R_(programming_language))

This  thing is wrong.If some plans  to use  OOP programming  just because  he read somewhere  and thinks it is cool , it should abandon it  very fast. This is my first(*and last*) class  implemented in R.
```
informationEnergy<-function(v)
{

frequencies=table(as.numeric(v))
prob=frequencies/length(v)
#from 21 to  28  is trash
#probreplace=c() 
 
#for( i in 1:length(v)){
#el=prob[as.character(v[i])]
#probreplace=c(probreplace,el)
 
#}
 
inf=sum(prob^2)

  return(new("energy",
          informationEnergy=inf,
          prob=prob))

}
oncoef=function(v,w)
{
i1=informationEnergy(v)
i2=informationEnergy(w)
informationEnergy1=i1@informationEnergy
informationEnergy2=i2@informationEnergy
#probabilities1=i1@prob
#probabilities2=i2@prob

probval1=c() 
 
for( i in 1:length(v)){
el=i1@prob[as.character(v[i])]
probval1=c(probval1,el)
}
probval2=c() 
 
for( i in 1:length(w)){
el=i2@prob[as.character(w[i])]
probval2=c(probval2,el)
}
N=probval1%*%probval2
N=as.numeric(N)

R=N/sqrt(i1@informationEnergy*i2@informationEnergy)
return(R)
}

setClass(Class="energy",
         representation(
            informationEnergy="numeric",
            prob="table"
          )
 )         
 ```
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
